Data Structures

struct  ParagraphContext

Detailed Description

The class BidiManager allows to prepare strings for languages, which require a bidirectional output. Usually the characters of a string are aligned in logical order and must be converted into a string representing the visual order.

INT BidiManager::RemoveFormattingCodes (  WCHAR *  text,
INT  char_count
) 
 

Removes formatting codes from text. This method can be used to remove formatting codes so the ordering of the string can be compared to implementations that remove formatting codes. This implementation is limited to the pseudo alphabet used for the demo version.

void BidiManager::SetActive (  BOOLEAN  flag  )  [inline]
 

Activates the bidi-manager, if flag is TRUE. When the bidi-manager is activated, all APOXI-components display the text in the correct bidirectional-format. Because the conversion from a logical text to a bidi-formatted text takes some time, it might be useful the deactivate the bidi-manager for languages which don't support bidirectional texts.
